CPC-specific-text.text: mountaineering ropes A63B29/02

reference.text: ; mechanical finishing or dressing of ropes D02J;

CPC-specific-text.text: braiding D04C

reference.text: ; decorative ropes or cords D04D; suspension cables for bridges E01D19/16; specially adapted for driving, or for being driven by, pulleys or other gearing elements F16G9/00; electric cables or joints insofar as electrical aspects are essential H01B, H01R

note.note-paragraph: In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

title-part.text: Constructional features of ropes or cables

note.note-paragraph:
Group D07B1/00 is impacted by reclassification into group D07B1/24.
Groups D07B1/00 and D07B1/24 should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

CPC-specific-text.text: Composite ropes, i.e. ropes built-up from fibrous or filamentary material and metal wires

title-part.text: Ropes built-up from fibrous or filamentary material, e.g. of vegetable origin, of animal origin, regenerated cellulose, plastics

CPC-specific-text.text: comprising high modulus, or high tenacity, polymer filaments or fibres, e.g. liquid-crystal polymers

title-part.text: with a core of fibres or filaments arranged parallel to the centre line
Ropes or cables built-up from metal wires, e.g. of section wires around a hemp core

CPC-specific-text.text: Reinforcing cords for rubber or plastic articles
the reinforcing cords being characterised by the rope configuration
the reinforcing cords being characterised by the strand configuration
the reinforcing cords consisting of three core wires or filaments and at least one layer of outer wires or filaments, i.e. a 3+N configuration
having a multiple-layer configuration
the reinforcing cords being twisted and with at least one wire exchanging place with another wire
comprising longitudinally preformed wires
in the core
the wires being made from special alloy or special steel composition
the wires being characterised by an anti-corrosive or adhesion promoting coating
having a rope configuration
characterised by the strand design
characterised by the core design
having a strand configuration

title-part.text: the layers of which are formed of profiled interlocking wires, i.e. the strands forming concentric layers
with a core of wires arranged parallel to the centre line
Ropes or cables with a hollow core
Ropes or cables with incorporated auxiliary elements, e.g. for marking, extending throughout the length of the rope or cable

note.note-paragraph:
Group D07B1/14 is impacted by reclassification into group D07B1/24.
Groups D07B1/14 and D07B1/24 should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

CPC-specific-text.text: comprising liquid, pasty or powder agents, e.g. lubricants or anti-corrosive oils or greases
for ropes or rope components built-up from fibrous or filamentary material
for cables or cable components built-up from metal wires
comprising elements for indicating or detecting the rope or cable status

note.note-paragraph:
Group D07B1/145 is impacted by reclassification into group D07B1/24.
Groups D07B1/145 and D07B1/24 should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

CPC-specific-text.text: comprising electric conductors or elements for information transfer
comprising marks or luminous elements

title-part.text: Ropes or cables with an enveloping sheathing or inlays of rubber or plastics

CPC-specific-text.text: characterised by a plastic or rubber enveloping sheathing
characterised by a plastic or rubber inlay
having a predetermined shape
characterised by the eye construction

title-part.text: Buoyant ropes, e.g. with air-filled cellular cores
Sets of ropes consisting of a series of parallel ropes

note.note-paragraph:
Group D07B1/22 is impacted by reclassification into group D07B5/045.
Groups D07B1/22 and D07B5/045 should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

CPC-specific-text.text: Ropes or cables with a prematurely failing element

note.note-paragraph:
Group D07B1/24 is incomplete pending reclassification of documents from groups D07B1/00, D07B1/14, and D07B1/145.
All groups listed in this Warning should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

title-part.text: General-purpose machines or apparatus for producing twisted ropes or cables from component strands of the same or different material

CPC-specific-text.text: with alternating twist directions

title-part.text: in which the supply reels rotate about the axis of the rope or cable

CPC-specific-text.text: or in which a guide member rotates about the axis of the rope or cable to guide the component strands away from the supply reels in fixed position

note.note-paragraph:
Group D07B3/02 is impacted by reclassification into group D07B3/022.
Groups D07B3/02 and D07B3/022 should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

CPC-specific-text.text: with provision for imparting two or more twists to the filaments for each revolution of the guide member

note.note-paragraph:
Group D07B3/022 is incomplete pending reclassification of documents from groups D07B3/02 and D01H1/10.
Groups D07B3/02, D01H1/10, and D07B3/022 should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

title-part.text: and are arranged in tandem along the axis of the machine

CPC-specific-text.text: , e.g. tubular or high-speed type stranding machine
with the reels axially aligned, their common axis coinciding with the axis of the machine

title-part.text: and are spaced radially from the axis of the machine

CPC-specific-text.text: , i.e. basket or planetary-type stranding machine

title-part.text: in which the take-up reel rotates about the axis of the rope or cable

CPC-specific-text.text: or in which a guide member rotates about the axis of the rope or cable to guide the rope or cable on the take-up reel in fixed position

title-part.text: and the supply reels are fixed in position

CPC-specific-text.text: in which a guide member rotates about the axis of the rope or cable to guide the rope or cable on the take-up reel in fixed position

title-part.text: with provision for imparting more than one complete twist to the ropes or cables for each revolution of the take-up reel

CPC-specific-text.text: or of the guide member
characterised by the bow construction
characterised by comprising two bows, both guiding the same bundle to impart a twist

title-part.text: operating with rotating loops of filaments
Making ropes or cables from special materials or of particular form

characterised by their outer shape or surface properties
by the properties of an outer surface polymeric coating
comprising postformed and thereby radially plastically deformed elements

title-part.text: from straw or like vegetable material

Group D07B5/04 is impacted by reclassification into group D07B5/045.

Preforming the wires or strands prior to closing

title-part.text: Devices for imparting reverse rotation to bobbin- or reel cages
Bearing supports or brakes for supply bobbins or reels
Alarms or stop motions responsive to exhaustion or breakage of filamentary material fed from supply reels or bobbins
Devices for taking-up or winding the finished rope or cable
for softening, lubricating or impregnating ropes, cables, or component strands thereof
for coating or wrapping ropes, cables, or component strands thereof

reference.text: applying liquids or other fluent materials to surfaces in general B05; wrapping elongated cores in general B65H81/06

CPC-specific-text.text: Coating or filling-up interstices
Vices or clamps for bending or holding the rope or cable during splicing
for making slings
for joining rope components
for interconnecting two cable or rope ends, e.g. by splicing or sewing

reference.text: fixation or holding of the ends prior to or during splicing D07B7/162; joining the rope or cable components individually or joining the rope ends by permanent means such as welding, gluing or crimp sleeve D07B7/167; preparing the splice by opening the ends D07B7/18

title-part.text: for spreading or untwisting ropes or cables into constituent parts for treatment or splicing purposes

CPC-specific-text.text: for spreading ropes or cables by hand-operated tools for splicing purposes, e.g. needles or spikes
for temporarily untwisting ropes or cables into constituent parts for applying a coating
for forming bulbs in ropes or cables

title-part.text: characterised by being laid or braided from several sub-ropes or sub-cables, e.g. hawsers
characterised by the use of different strands
Structures that change the cross-sectional shape
characterised by the number of strands
three to eight strands respectively forming a single layer
nine or more strands respectively forming multiple layers
characterised by a value or range of the pitch parameter given
using regular lay, i.e. the wires or filaments being parallel to rope axis
using lang lay, i.e. the wires or filaments being inclined relative to the rope axis
using alternate lay, i.e. the wires or filaments in the strands being oppositely inclined relative to the rope axis
characterised by lay direction of the strand compared to the lay direction of the wires in the strand
Compact winding, i.e. S/S or Z/Z
Cylinder winding, i.e. S/Z or Z/S
characterised by a value or range of the dimension given
characterised by a value or range of the dimension given
characterised by a value or range of the pitch parameter given
having the same lay direction and lay pitch
Cylinder winding, i.e. S/Z or Z/S
comprising crossing wires or filaments in the same layer
characterised by the use of different wires or filaments
regarding the dimension of the wires or filaments
characterised by the number of wires or filaments
three to eight wires or filaments respectively forming a single layer
nine or more wires or filaments respectively forming multiple layers
having protrusions extending radially functioning as spacer between strands or wires
characterised by a value or range of the dimension given
being discontinuous in the longitudinal direction
characterised by the elongation or tension behaviour
characterised by the kind or amount of filling
being movable relative to the internal structure
Auxiliary components, e.g. electric conductors or light guides
characterized by special properties or the arrangements of the binding wire
High performance polyolefins, e.g. Dyneema or Spectra
Viscose or regenerated cellulose, e.g. Rayon
being of synthetic nature, e.g. chloroprene
having a low carbon content, e.g. below 0,5 percent respectively NT wires
having a medium carbon content, e.g. greater than 0,5 percent and lower than 0.8 percent respectively HT wires
having a high carbon content, e.g. greater than 0,8 percent respectively SHT or UHT wires
Brass, i.e. copper (Cu) and zinc (Zn) alloys
with means for providing less than double twist, e.g. counter rotating means
characterised by at least partially unwinding the twist of the upstream double twisting step
to change the crystal structure of the load bearing material
to heat towards the glass transition temperature of the load bearing material
to soften the load bearing material
Means for mechanically reducing serpentining or mechanically killing of rope
comprising means for stopping or shutting down the machine
being of the extended closed loop control system type, e.g. using models or more than one signal in the feedback loop
System input signals, e.g. set points
Signals indicating failure or excessive conditions, e.g. overheating
Breakage of wire or strand or rope
Feedback signal in closed loop controls

Aspects related to the problem to be solved or advantage
comprising compensation of rope twist in strand twist
Improving filler wetting respectively or filler adhesion

related to rope or cable making machines
Linked indexing codes associated with indexing codes or classes of D07B

note.note-paragraph: The following indexing codes are applied as linked indexing codes associated to other indexing codes or classes of D07B, with the following restrictions:D07B2801/10, D07B2801/14 -D07B2801/22 are only to be used as linked indexing codes with D07B2205/00 and lower hierarchy D07B2801/12 and D07B2801/24 are only to be used as linked indexing codes with D07B2205/00 and lower hierarchy or D07B2201/2047 and lower hierarchy D07B2801/60 and D07B2801/62 are only to be used as linked indexing codes with D07B2207/404 and lower hierarchy D07B2801/90 is only used as linked indexing code with any class or indexing code of D07B and defines that the classified feature belongs to the general knowledge.

title-part.text: Smallest filamentary entity of a rope or strand, i.e. wire, filament, fiber or yarn
